curam.util.persistence

Class BaseDAOImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,S extends DeepCloneable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.persistence.DAOImpl<I,E,S>
      • curam.util.persistence.BaseDAOImpl<I,E,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the identifier type used by both:
    • the logical entity; and
    • the row used to "seed" the entity
    E - the type of entity instances which are created by this class
    S - the database row from which entity instances are created
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReaderDAO<I,E>

    @Implementable
public abstract class BaseDAOImpl<I,E extends Entity<I>,S extends DeepCloneable>
extends DAOImpl<I,E,S>
    Base class for DAO implementations for abstract base classes. Base classes can be read from the database but not created (instead a concrete class must be created). The ID of the entity must also be the ID of the row used to "seed" the entity.

    • Method Detail

      • getConcreteReaderDAOs

        protected abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ReaderDAO<I,? extends E>> getConcreteReaderDAOs()
        Gets a map of concrete reader DAOs. Each DAO is keyed on its discriminator value, so that processing can look up the appropriate concrete DAO to read the entity based on the discriminator value held in the row. Implementations must override this method to provide an appropriate map of reader DAOs.
        Returns:
        TODO: JavaDoc

      • getDiscriminator

        protected abstract java.lang.String getDiscriminator(RowManager<I,S> rowManager)
        Get the discriminator value of the row supplied. The discriminator value enables processing to identify the concrete type of logical entity. Implementations must override this method to determine the discriminator value from the base entity row.
        Parameters:
        rowManager - TODO: JavaDoc
        Returns:
        TODO: JavaDoc

      • newInstance

        public E newInstance(EntityInfo<I,E,S> entityInfo)
        Creates an in-memory instance of the logical entity based on the entity information supplied.
        Parameters:
        entityInfo - The information about the instance to create.
        Returns:
        An in-memory instance of the logical entity.
